intro: Alectorolophus modestus, commonly known as the modest lophus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae, which includes a variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Its botanical features include a woody stem and opposite leaf arrangement. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
